title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Prevailing showery and windy condition over the south western parts of the island is expected to continue today (21), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: All passenger transport drivers required to obtain ‘PT License’ by December 31 – Transport Minister
byline: Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Bimal Rathnayake has stated that it is mandatory to all drivers engaged in passenger transport to obtain a “PT License” (Public Transport License) before December 31.

title: Trump issues vague threat to Afghanistan over Bagram air base
byline: US President Donald Trump on Saturday (Sep 20) threatened Afghanistan with unspecified punishment if the Taliban-controlled country did not “give Bagram Airbase back”.

title: Pentagon imposes new restrictions on media covering the US military
byline: The Pentagon has unveiled new restrictions on media covering the US military, requiring them to pledge not to disclose anything not formally authorized for publication and limiting their movements within the Department of War.

title: Israel presses on with Gaza City assault, at least 60 Palestinians killed
byline: Israel’s military kept up its assault on Gaza City and the wider Gaza Strip on Saturday, dismantling underground shafts and booby-trapped structures in attacks that killed at least 60 Palestinians, according to Gazan health authorities.

title: 21-year-old youth attacked to death over personal dispute
byline: A youth has been attacked to death with a sharp weapon in the Balawathgama area of the Hemmathagama Police Division.

title: Indian naval ship ‘INS SATPURA’ arrives at Colombo Port
byline: The Indian Naval Ship ‘INS SATPURA’ has arrived at the Port of Colombo for replenishment and service requirements yesterday (20).

title: Drug shortage stems from procurement issues, not financial constraints – Health Minister
byline: Health Minister Nalinda Jayatissa has stated that the prevailing shortage of medicines within the country is not due to financial constraints.

title: President to leave for US tomorrow to attend UN General Assembly
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to leave for the United States tomorrow (22).

title: British PM set to announce recognition of Palestinian state today
byline: Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer is expected to announce the UK’s recognition of a Palestinian state in a statement on Sunday afternoon.

title: 47-year-old Karandeniya PS Chairman dies due to sudden illness
byline: Chairman of Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha Mahil Munasinghe, has passed away due to a sudden illness.

title: Special island-wide police raids result in over 700 arrests
byline: Sri Lanka Police announced that a total of 714 suspects were arrested yesterday (20) during island-wide operations conducted under the instructions of the Inspector General of Police (IGP) to combat crime and drug-related offenses.

title: CEB workers to further intensify trade union action from tomorrow
byline: Several trade unions of the Ceylon Electricity Board have announced that they will intensify their trade union action further against the proposed restructuring of the CEB, effective midnight today.

title: Tesla wins approval to test autonomous robotaxis in Arizona
byline: Tesla has been approved to start testing autonomous robotaxi vehicles with a safety monitor in Arizona, the state transportation department said in an email to Reuters on Friday.

title: White House says new H-1B visa fee applies only to new applicants
byline: The White House said on Saturday that the new 100,000-U.S.-dollar fee for H-1B visas will not apply to current holders of valid visas re-entering the United States, following confusion and concern sparked by the Trump administration’s introduction of the measure.

title: Mild earthquake shakes Dhaka, other parts of Bangladesh
byline: A mild tremor shook Dhaka and several other parts of Bangladesh on Sunday afternoon (21).

title: Investigative report on substance found in Netolpitiya due next week
byline: The investigative report on the substances discovered on a plot of land in Netolpitiya, Tangalle is expected to be released to police next week, the National Dangerous Drugs Control Board has stated.

title: European airports race to fix check-in glitch after hacking disruption
byline: Some of Europe’s biggest airports, including the region’s busiest Heathrow, raced on Sunday to restore normal operations to automatic check-in systems after disruption caused by hackers a day earlier.

title: Sri Lanka’s commitment to ensure Indian Ocean remains zone of peace reaffirmed
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Defence, Air Vice Marshal Sampath Thuyacontha (Retd) has reaffirmed Sri Lanka’s longstanding commitment to ensuring that the Indian Ocean remains a zone of peace, open to cooperation and free from conflict, the Ministry of Defence said in a statement.

title: Chinese ‘research ship’ Yuan Wang 5 re-enters Indian Ocean after three years
byline: Three years after its controversial entry into the Indian Ocean, China’s Yuan Wang 5 — a vessel officially designated as a ‘research ship’ but widely recognised as a sophisticated intelligence-gathering platform — has once again been tracked near the region, sparking fresh concerns in India’s security establishment.

title: Morrissey cancels US shows after death threat in Canada
byline: British artist Morrissey has cancelled two shows in the US after receiving a death threat ahead of a concert in Ottawa, Canada.

title: No cuts to religious education and aesthetic subjects – Prime Minister
byline: Under the current government, there will be no reduction or removal of religious education or aesthetic subjects in any way, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has affirmed.

title: CAA conducts 70 rice-related raids last week
byline: A total of 70 raids related to rice have been conducted by the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) last week.

title: World’s oldest person, 116, meets King Charles
byline: King Charles III has made a special visit to the world’s oldest person, who told him she remembered “all the girls were in love with you and wanted to marry you”.

title: Duo arrested in connection with assault on German nationals in Unawatuna
byline: Two individuals involved in a tourism sector in Rumassala, Unawatuna, have been arrested by the Tourist Police in connection with an alleged assault on a group of German nationals.

title: New directive issued on testing drivers under the influence of narcotics
byline: A new directive outlining the procedure that police officers must follow when inspecting drivers suspected of operating vehicles under the influence of narcotics has been issued by the Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports, and Civil Aviation.

title: Airport cyberattack disrupts more flights across Europe
byline: Fallout from a cyberattack that disrupted check-in systems at several European airports extended into a second full day on Sunday, as passengers faced dozens of canceled and delayed flights — and the impact poised to worsen for at least one major airport.

title: UK, Canada and Australia recognise Palestinian state in major diplomatic shift
byline: The United Kingdom, Canada and Australia confirmed today (21) that they now formally recognize Palestinian statehood, piling pressure on Israel.

title: Body of a male found near canal in Ibbagamuwa
byline: A body of a young male who had died under mysterious circumstances has been discovered near a canal in Ibbagamuwa by the Gokarella Police.

title: Drug trafficker ‘Potta Amila’ arrested along with three associates
byline: A key member of an organized crime gang and known drug trafficker, ‘Potta Amila’ has been arrested by the Moragahahena Police, along with three of his close associates.

title: 18-year-old from Malta arrested with materials suspected to be used in manufacturing ‘Ice’
byline: An 18-year-old from Malta has been arrested with materials suspected to be used in manufacturing ICE during a raid in Weligama, police stated.

title: India’s ED to question jailed Sri Lankan woman in LTTE funding case
byline: The Enforcement Directorate of India (ED) has secured permission from a Chennai court to interrogate Sri Lankan national, Letchumanan Mary Franciska, in connection with a money laundering probe linked to an alleged attempt to revive the banned terrorist organisation Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE), Indian media reported.
